Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: BigDave
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything we required and deserves its rating. The location is within 400 metres of a cinema and at least 5 restaurants. Shops are about 600 m away. One point, the shuttle is very popular in the mornings when people are going to work so you may choose to budget for some taxis at this time, or allow time for dropping other people off before your stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: Luke S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a overnight as the hotel was full the second night. It is conveniently situated next to the highway 40 and Cavendish exit. Many restaurant and stores, movie theatre can be found within 1 KM of the hotel. Rooms are great, nicely decor and stylish furniture. There is a shared pool/whirlpool with the Residence Inn (same building) but seperate hotels. Restaurant is on site. Free parking, free shuttle to airport till around midnight, reservation needed as per sign at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SIST
Reviews.Content: I spent only a few hours in this hotel while in transit. The hotel is superb. Beautiful and comfortable, great stay. Superclean and food was very good even though very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to airport”
Reviews.Author: johncrawcarp
Reviews.Content: Nice workout facilities (24/7 very convenient) including pool and hot-tub. Snack store with small selection + microwave (popcorn etc.) Restaurant (too expensive- never use). Helpful, courteous, friendly staff. Coffee bar convenient (good coffee- better than room). In room; coffee maker, fridge, small work area (TV on same desk). Bed comfortable (pillows too soft- would be nice to have choice similar to Holiday Inn). Location is excellent as shopping mall, theatres, restaurants, pub are all within a short walking distance (even in cold winter conditions).

Reviews.Title: “NOT near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: ScottinTaghkanic
Reviews.Content: Marriott has a lot of brass calling this an airport location. To be more direct, it is downright misleading and not true, especially considering the fact that downtown Montreal is as distant from the airport as this property.. Arriving at 9PM and departing at 6AM, it took between 20-25 minutes, door to door. This was with no traffic whatsoever. The rooms are what you'd expect for the dollar. We got sort of a kick out of the restaurant's pretensions. White linen tablecloths, waiters in bistro aprons, AND portion control butter, ketchup, etc. The room is no more than moderately attractive, the service inadequate and the prices are much too high for the calibre of the food that is served. The property is located in a virtual wasteland, that is especially unattractive; seemingly in an enormous corporate/light industrial park. There is no public commerce [reatil restaurants, convenience stores, etc.] anywhere within walking distance. If it weren't for Marriott's blatantly falsely promoting this as an airport location, I'd have given it the property.three stars instead of the two. In summation: beware of Marriott and even with that caveat, try them last.

Reviews.Title: “I stopped going there”
Reviews.Author: Economytraveler18
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and have stayed there over 10 times. My last visit, however, the reception lady was very rude and treats guests as if they are a burden on her. She would actually go out of her way to make your life miserable. It is that lady with a heavy French accent English. She works the morning shift in the weekdays I think. I have had bad 2 encounters with her. Everything else in the hotel was great; Rocco in the evening shift was an excellent customer service person. The pool staffs were excellent. The rooms were clean. This lady makes you want to leave as soon as you get there because you want to avoid seeing her.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, very comfortable rooms, nice & expensive restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Ta10p
Reviews.Content: ok as far as Marriotts go; beautiful entrance, very comfortable business centre and the fireplace is a nice touch. Rooms well designed with cozy comfort in mind. Great windows letting in a lot of light and really comfortable colours bathe the room with a relaxing atmosphere. Shower head delivers a great spray and finally a washroom with good lighting; that is appreciated!!! Temperature control works wonderfully AND in quiet comfort - nicer than many "nicer" hotels. Desk staff very kind and wanting to help. Near many restaurants and other amenities including many within walking distance. Very well arranged exercise room and equipment seemed clean, We only used the walking apparatus and it was in good order. Familiar readers will recognize this gripe: what's with the "tons of chlorine" pool?? Please Marriotts, get to salt water pools already will ya!! Would I go back? YES!

Reviews.Title: “Great property, easy access to Montreal and the airport”
Reviews.Author: RoamWorld
Reviews.Content: My family and I (teenagers and spouse) recently stayed here while on business in Montreal. The location is about 10 minutes out of the city and also close to the airport. We loved the property. Very clean, great room and bathroom! The pool was very nice as was their fitness room. Although we were not flying, the status board of flights in the lobby is a real plus. We would definitely stay here again while visiting family and friends in Montreal and/or en route to Ottawa. Convenient to a variety of restaurants and also the movies. A great Marriott property!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel, All the Reviews are accurate”
Reviews.Author: banjo60
Reviews.Content: Not much more to say about this hotel that hasn't already been said. We really enjoyed our stay. Room was nice and spacious, the bathroom was big and immaculate and the service was excellent. Internet was super fast. Was only a 5 minute drive to the Namur Metro Station which we took into downtown Montreal. Can't say enough good things about this hotel, stay here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near YUL Airport”
Reviews.Author: 98travels2go
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while in town for business. I've stayed in downtown Montreal before, but since my meetings were near the airport I didn't feel a need to be downtown on this trip. This was probably the best Courtyard I've ever stayed at. No matter where you were in the hotel (lobby, business center, restaurant, bar, etc.) it had a comfortable atmosphere and the staff was very friendly. The hotel shuttle was quick and convenient. There are plenty of restaurants in walking distance and only 1 to 2 blocks away. There's also a movie theater and a large shopping mall in walking distance. It was raining when I was there so I was mostly confined to my room. The room was average size, but due to the unique layout it felt spacious. The bed was comfortable and so was the sofa for watching TV. The only thing that would have made this an excellent rating for me would be the analog TV signal. I don't understand why most of these hotels are upgrading to nice flat screen TV's but not upgrading to a digital signal. All this does is magnify the fuzzy picture. If I wasn't in the hotel for most of the evening, this would not have been a big deal. I will definitely be back the next time I need to stay close to the Montreal Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is first class”
Reviews.Author: DenverDsigner
Reviews.Content: From the staff, helpful and professional, to the rooms-modern, and nicely appointed with high-end finishes and fixtures, to the heavenly chocolate and ice cream dessert, this hotel is top-notch. The hotel is well thought out and executed. Located on the airport property, no van hassles, and public transportation; train and bus will easily get you into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Near to airport and Mall”
Reviews.Author: bettylopez10
Reviews.Content: The advantage of staying in this hotel is that its near the airport and near to a mall as well as to a business park. Average hotel. Breakfast is nothing fancy. Since I have stayed in numerous Marriot hotels, I would say this is a typical Marriot Courtyard room. Internet and parking is free.This is a no smoking hotel. Its located just beside another Marriot property, Residence Inn and they share some facilities like the pool. Its also near the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveandBeverley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back to Toronto from down east last weekend. The check in was smooth and went without a hitch although there was no one there to help with our baggage and the cart etc. The room was larger than most, so was the washroom. The entire room was modern and clean. The beds were comfortable. Even though we were close to the airport, we were not bothered by the aircraft flying past. We used the pool and hot tub, again, no problem. We would consider this hotel again, unless we were sticking around Montreal to actually see the city. In that case, we'd look for something closer to the downtown as this hotel is a bit of a drive from the downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “Extended weekend made enjoyable by having space in our room!”
Reviews.Author: CelticGinger
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of cheap flights to Montreal on June 25, 2011 and spent two nights at the Courtyard. We did arrive before check-in but were graciously accommodated and upgraded to an "extended room" with a sofabed (and more space), which was better with two teens in our family. A large counter is in the spacious bath. There was a refrigerator in the room. This hotel is out of the city, but my husband would rather drive than pay a higher rate in downtown Montreal. The other issue: this hotel had queen-size beds, downtown offers only doubles. Parking at this Courtyard is free; there is a fee to park downtown. When checking in, the desk staff were very pleasant. All interactions during our stay with the staff were pleasant. Coffee and tea are available in the morning in the lobby. While we did not eat in the hotel dining room, the staff there were gracious in supplying hot water for tea in the evening, and the dining room tables were set with cloth table covers and napkins: very nice. A step above Courtyards in the USA! While this hotel is near the airport, I hardly heard any airplanes, and never had my sleep disturbed by outside noise.

Reviews.Title: “3c's! Comfortable, CLEAN and convenient”
Reviews.Author: tcnm2008
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel to just sleep in at night, that's clean and close to the highway & restaurants, this hotel is probably one you should consider. We got two rooms. My fiance, and two of our friends came on this trip with us. Our rooms were not put side by side although we did request for this upon checking in. No biggie. Service: Don't expect Hilton treatment but the concierge desk employees were quite polite and the check in/check out process was smooth & easy. Comfort in room: The rooms were very clean (as with most Courtyard Marriotts). The only feature the rooms lacked was a security box. Other than that, I thought the rooms were very well equipped with a fridge and all toiletries available. Parking: Parking was free at this hotel Convenience: If you have a car, it is extremely convenient to get onto the highway. A drive to downtown was no more than 20-25 minutes away. There are many restaurants in the area nearby the hotel within walking distance (maybe less than 5 minute walk down the road) where you'll find nice restaurants such as "Divinos", or fast food restaurants such as McDonalds. If you go down the street and walk another 10 minutes, you'll find a pretty decent sized shopping mall with a food court inside, Zeller's and even a TD Canada Trust bank. Again, overall, if you're looking for a quiet, clean, comfortable and convenient place to stay, this is it! It also isn't very expensive to stay here. You can alway's find pretty good rates with hotels.ca :) P.s. the bar/restaurant at the hotel closes early. I believe the bar/restaurant was closed by 11pm. The restaurants nearby also close roughly around the same time. I think within a block of Divino's there are a couple of breakfast/brunch places. One of which is called Cora's

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place near Restaurants and a Movie Theatre”
Reviews.Author: Colin51
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay the night before my flight back to SNA. I bought the room on Priceline and of course got a great rate. I called from the airport kiosk to have the hotel shuttle come pick me up, was put on hold for what I consider an unacceptable amount of time. I hung up and went to the Airport Information center and asked where to go for the Hotel Shuttle pickups and was directed to an area. After the Sheraton Shuttle driver told me that the Courtyard Shuttle would be by soon, I waited and waited only to have her tell me the next time she came around I had to call. So I then went back into the airport and called again from the kiosk and this time they picked up the phone right away and said the shuttle was almost there. I went out and got the shuttle right away. I was surprised at how far away the hotel was from the airport. It is located in a very mixed use area of light industrial with a small Movie and Restaurant complex within a couple of blocks walking distance. Another review complimented Rocco for his customer service and I received the same from him. Good job Rocco. The hotel I was told is only four years old and is really very nicely appointed everywhere. The two things that bothered me was the hallway noise was very loud through the gap under my room door and the bath mat was extremely worn and tattered. I took bath mat down with me when I checked out and asked for the onsite manager and was told that she was not there and that I could email her. The lady at the front desk did not understand what I was talking about and thought I was showing her how small the mat was, thinking it was supposed to be a bath towel. I then indicated the frayed edges and said that this was embarrassing for them to have such a tattered and worn bath mat in the room. I would stay there again for the same reason but not if I was a tourist visiting for vacation, as it is not close to anything.

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable front desk”
Reviews.Author: Budbobo
Reviews.Content: We were lost, looking for another hotel where we had reservations. Rocco at the front desk was enormously helpful in pointing us in the right direction and printing out directions and a map. Gave us his card if we needed follow up. If only all in the hospitality industry could be so customer-oriented!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel. but not for tourism in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Ottawan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Montreal Airport many times. It is a relatively new property, spotless, with very clean and spacious rooms, comfortable beds, friendly staff and free internet. My wife and I love staying at this property. There is nothing negative about this property. But, it is located in the north end of the city, in the suburban area called St. Laurent. My wife and I are ex-Montrealers and we stay at this hotel most times when we visit relatives who live in the immediate area. But, we hardly ever go downtown and are not in Montreal for tourism. If your visit takes you to the north end, by all means, stay at this hotel. If you are in Montreal for tourism, to explore the city, then find a property downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you want from a Courtyard and more”
Reviews.Author: sbenus
Reviews.Content: I was in MontrÃ©al for the Formula One Grand Prix last year and stayed at this hotel. I know it's been a while but I had forgotten to write a review and looking back I really wanted to compliment the hotel staff for making our stay excellent. The hotel is close to the airport so there is nothing really much to do right around the hotel but this is to be expected as it is mainly a business hotel. There are some good restaurants right nearby including a couple bars and a sports bar. I had never been to MontrÃ©al and recommend it to everybody after going. It is a great town! Back to the hotel, all of the staff at front desk were very friendly and helpful. We had an accessibility issue at the racetrack with my motorized wheelchair and the hotel staff lent us a manual chair for the entire weekend. This truly saved our trip. We had breakfast every morning at the hotel's restaurant and it was very good and reasonably priced. The wait staff were also very friendly (I'm sure it didn't hurt that they were mostly Latin as am I. A little Spanish in MontrÃ©al goes a long way apparently). We stayed a couple extra days after the races in order to enjoy the city and one of those days we met the hotel's general manager recommended we drive to Mont Tremblant. The drive was a little over an hour and was definitely worth it, this is a beautiful little town up in the mountains. After doing some shopping the last day, I had purchased an item which turns out wouldn't fit in my luggage. Again, the helpful general manager made sure to send it by mail to my house. We were out of the hotel almost the entire day every day and without exception, our rooms were impeccable every time we returned. Physically, the hotel is what you would expect of any Courtyard but it's the staff that makes this property stand out. I would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: busyworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was our first time there. The rooms were big and the beds comfortable. Very clean. Loved it. Will visit again if we go to Montreal again. The complimentary breakfast was also good.

Reviews.Title: “clean, but not very convenient”
Reviews.Author: 80serendip
Reviews.Content: it is clean, but not that convenient for since i am interested in visiting the city and the price is not bad while bidding from priceline for 50 bucks per night parking is also free

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the finest hotels I have...”
Reviews.Author: vegas005
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest hotels I have stayed at in a long time. From the bus driver to the maintenance man this hotel is run with precision. The hotel is spotless with not a crumb on the floor in the lobby, halls, work out room, pool, laundry room or my guest room. Frankly I haven't ever seen a hotel so clean. On my first night my hair dryer failed. I mentioned this to a maintenace man I ran into in the hall and he immediately fixed it. In the lobby the mouse for one of the customer pc work stations was not working well... I mentioned this and it was immediately fixed. The team at this Courtyard have a lot of pride and are well trained. My room was great, the bed was super comfortable and my overall stay was great. I give this hotel my highest rating ever. 100 out of 100. Well done guys!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: alexmatos1979
Reviews.Content: Got the room via priceline, so my rate was significantly lower than market. The hotel was very clean, the room as well. Very nice bed, great design, and the staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would definately stay again!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCat314
Reviews.Content: After a hellish week at the Delta in downtown Montreal, this was a refreshing and beautiful place to stay. The hotel is very much geared towards business travelers(free wifi, a free business center, computers, etc). I was really impressed by the extraordinary clean rooms and the friendly staff. We arrived at the hotel around 10pm at night, hadn't eaten for most of the day, and the front desk staff immediately let us know where and what places were good and what was open this time of night. I was thrilled to talk to a front desk person who was so enthusiastic, friendly, and most of all, willing to help us. The bed was unbelievably comfortable, and the location, even though its a bit far from downtown, had its share of entertainment nearby. There was a movie theater, restaurant, and plenty of shopping malls within walking distance. It's also close to the airport(with a free shuttle), which is also a bonus. Fabulous hotel, can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: TeeL69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights and enjoyed every night. The hotel looked new. Check-in was without any problem and the staff was very friendly. Now to the rooms: Room was big, this makes your stay more comfortable especially on long stays. Evrything was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is located close to a small shopping center where you can find some good restaurants. If you are visiting Montreal, this hotel might be too far from the down town. I highly recommend this hotel for Business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mailmanwill
Reviews.Content: A nice place to stay for a "Park & Fly" with the free shuttle to the Pierre Trudeau airport , we left our car for three weeks once with no problems. The rooms are a little small for four and the breakfast O.K. but a little expensive for a family of four. A little far from downtown and old Montreal but a very nice place to stay for a couple of nights if you come by car as it is right off the Hwy. 40. Plus there are a few reasonable restaurants in the area. Another plus, the pool for the kids and the well equipped fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Hank_from_Moncton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on February 12 before flying to Cuba on Air Canada the next day. Everything at hotel is top flight. We sat in the bar the night before and watched the opening of the Olympics on the Flat Screen TVs. Prices are typical for a hotel but portions in the bar were better than I expected. We shared apetizers and had drinks. They don't allow the carts from the airport with your luggage upstairs but did not make a fuss when I said I just wanted to get our luggage to the room and would bring the 2 carts back down.There are lots of carts just outside the hotel entrance to get again in the morning. In the morning there is a very good coffee takeout in the lobby so don't bother going into the airport to find cheaper coffee. Its prices were excellent value for excellent coffee. The room was one of the nicest I have been in and I stay at Marriotts, Deltas, and Hilton all the time.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is the Best in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: tgfx
Reviews.Content: This place is one of the best in Montreal. Great location, great staff and a great looking hotel. Not only that but there is no charge for parking. I would like to say WHATUP to ROCCO. He made our stay wonderful. Keep it up Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JOHNPETRIE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott the weekend of July 30 to August 3. We were in Montreal for a 3 day convention. This is a new, well kept hotel. The rooms are of reasonable size and the beds are very comfortable. There are a variety of restaurants in the area of the hotel and highway access is close.We had the buffet breakfast one day and it was good, although a little expensive-$14.75. Our 6 year old was $8, and she only ate part of a Belgium waffle. Over all a great hotel and we had a good time and a great price, (convention rate). We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Sakana_San
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay there as they let us park our car while we were away for a week. Our flight was in the evening and they were able to extend our check-out time from 12pm to 1pm. I like their complementary airport shuttle bus service. Our room was very clean and there were two soap bars and a small bottle of shampoo & conditioner in the bathroom. Occasionally, we saw airplanes flying in and out of the nearby airport, MontrÃ©alâ€“Pierre Elliott Trudeau International Airport, but we were not bothered by the sound at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for park and fly”
Reviews.Author: Realisticone
Reviews.Content: Being a Holiday Inn member for years I was concerned of the number of bad reviews we read of their hotels near the Montreal Trudeau Airport. These are popular due to their park and fly options. We decided to try Courtyard by Mariott. What a pleasant surprise. The price for at two week park and fly including one night king room was $144 with tax. The hotel is clean and the room was great. Bathroom spotless and nice hand creams, body lotion, coffee maker. The bed is a comfort guarantee. Even though the room was on the freeway side the noise was non existent. Shuttle to and from the airport was free and the pick up and drop off very efficient. If you consider the cost of parking for two weeks you just can't go wrong. No, the parking is not covered nor is it secured as it is just the hotel parking lot but that was not the issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Hotel Not the Location”
Reviews.Author: gypsy92
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with good staff, comfortable bed, nice decor. The location in an industrial business park is not one for walking around and certainly not scenic. A bit complicated to get to from the highway--I could see it but couldn't get to it! You have to use a service road. It had a nice restaurant and there are a few in walking distance--a grill and a McDonalds. Long way to downtown and the Old City. The front desk gave me directions to the Metro station and that was better than driving and paying for parking. Not walkable to the Metro though. Fortunately I had a car. I think tourists would be better off downtown. Kind of inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Super amazing!!! Stay for the airport, cause it's not downtown.”
Reviews.Author: euroguy99
Reviews.Content: Great hotel... close to airport but you cannot hear the planes go by at night. Food is good, but expensive. Hotel quality is great, service is great and close to airport. Business services are great... 3 computers downstairs and free printer. Love it, love it, love it! I paid $104 for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Affordable, Brand New”
Reviews.Author: sens1992
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Montreal Montreal Airport for one night. The room was very clean with brand new furniture (hotel is brand new). The front desk agent was very friendly and our check-in was very fast. Very nice pool with salt water. Nice tub as well. Would defenetly recommend it and I will stay there again if going to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: EhMan
Reviews.Content: Had a one day training session so the company booked it for me. Brought the family over and extended it for one more day...total days: 2. Didn't expect anything special as I've never stayed in Courtyards. Usually Hojo types. Building looked bland, so no big deal. Didn't expect anything anyway. But I was really tired from sitting beside my crying children, anything with a roof would have been heaven. Wife drove because I haven't slept but that's for another story...Imagine our surprise, when the automatic doors opened, and were greeted with a warm Bonjour from the front desk. Wow! Great reception hall, at least for its kind...priceline rated it at 2.5 stars...it should get at least a 3.5 for the reception hall. Off to the rooms, and noticed the halls are wide (not like Vancouver hotels)--which was a good thing because we had a double side by side stroller...opened the rooms..Wow! very clean, and well appointed rooms! I thought wow, we got this room for $89!?! What a [----] bargain! Very clean, very nice bathroom...loved the delta faucets. Wish I could get these for my house. Our toddler immediately lit up and ran back and forth in the room... bounced up and down the bed. You don't know how much it was a relief to rest after 6 hours driving. With these kind of appointments, my wife actually was able to take out the clothes and use the drawers... she never use them because she says they're all "icky"...but here she was laying our clothes out, nice and folded. Complaints? Kids room in the basement is bland and nothing much in terms of activities there...well these are usually for business people, so I can't really blame the hotel...also our room window is facing the highway...the noise is not much, but its there and we hear some from the airport itself Overall, a great experience, family loved it...walked to the Spheron and checked out a small bistro there...great beef paninis and soup!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Billy Bird
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively expensive hotel for an airport hotel. However, it is lovely, newly decorated, modern, cosy. There is an airport shuttle bus which is fast and convenient, and the driver was great. The bus trip comes complete with complimentary apples and water too! The hotel itself is in quite a good location, close to a small-ish mall, cinema and a number of restaurants which are all within walking distance. It is also possible to walk to a tube station, but this might be a little too far for some: about half and hour's speed-march away. The only problem that I have with this hotel is: it is an airport hotel, and close to a busy road, and is therefore noisy. I am certainly not a light sleeper, but would have been gald of a pair of earplugs for this one!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: jblancast
Reviews.Content: Though the family stayed one night, we had a wonderful time there. Building, room, bathroom (washroom), room decor, and etc were in excellent conditions. One of the best Courtyards I have stayed in so far. Also, though our view including the flight path for the airport (kids loved it), you still could not hear any (jet) noise even with the window slightly open. Staff was helpful, bilingual, and greeted you with a smile. Though I am not sure what the other hotels around the airport offer, but I would recommend this facility to anybody needing accommodations near the airport. However the only complaint I have is the parking situation due to its location. There is only a dozen parking spaces located out front and the main parking lot was at the opposite end (from our room) of the building.
